Sequence Information.Source: Bacillus subtilis subsp. spizizenii DSM 15029(T) (Gram-positive bacteria)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the lantibiotic family (Class I bacteriocin)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.21239550] Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 29213 (MIC = 4-8 μg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 43300 (MRSA)(MIC = 8 μg/ml), Enterococcus faecalis ATCC 29212(MIC = 16μg/ml), Micrococcus luteus ATCC 9341(MIC = 4-8μg/ml), Enterococcus faecalis ATCC 51299 (VRE) (MIC = 8-16 μg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Nonterminal Modifications and Unusual Am: There are two dehydroalanines (S5; S31),one dehydrobutyrine (T18),one lanthionine (S3-C7) and four β-methyllanthionines (T8-C11; T13-C19; T23-C26; T25-C28).
Sequence Information.Predicted Structure: There is no predicted structure for DRAMP00002.
Sequence Information.Function: Entianin is very active against several Gram-positive pathogens, such as Staphylococcus aureus and Enterococcus faecalis.

Literature.Title: Entianin, a Novel Subtilin-Like Lantibiotic from Bacillus subtilis DSM 15029T with High Antimicrobial Activity.
Literature.Author: Fuchs SW, Jaskolla TW, Bochmann S, Kötter P, Wichelhaus T, Karas M, Stein T, Entian KD.
